sense.name: spread or diffuse through
sense.commentary: Syntax includes: NP1[agent] PERMEATE NP2[theme] NP1[agent] PERMEATE Note: May be reciprocal.
sense.examples: An atmosphere of distrust has permeated this administration. Water permeates sand easily. Daoism and confucianism permeate each other. The effects of deafness permeate every aspect of a person's life. Reality, it permeates, and conquers from within.
